chain::Real chain::Utl::DistanceToLine ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  lineA,
const Vector3 &  lineB 
) [static]

Calculate the shortest distance between a point and a line.

The line is defined by two points on it, lineA and lineB. This performs two calls to Vector3::Magnitude(), which each call CH_SQRT().

Parameters:
point - point to test against line
lineA - first point on line
lineB - second point on line
Returns:
chain::Real - shortest distance
See also:
DistanceToLineSquared()

Todo:
Call CH_SQRT() once, and use Vector3::MagnitudeSquared() rather than Vector3::Magnitude()

bool chain::Utl::DistanceToLineSegment ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  lineA,
const Vector3 &  lineB,
Real &  distance 
) [static]

Calculate the shortest distance between a point and a line segment.

The line is defined by two points on it, lineA and lineB. This performs two calls to Vector3::MagnitudeSquared(), which do not call CH_SQRT(). If the closest point to the line is outside the limits of lineA and lineB.

Parameters:
point - point to test against line
lineA - first point on line
lineB - second point on line
[out] distance - shortest distance
Returns:
bool - if the point is within the limits

bool chain::Utl::DistanceToLineSegmentSquared ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  lineA,
const Vector3 &  lineB,
Real &  distance_squared 
) [static]

Calculate the shortest distance squared between a point and a line segment.

The line is defined by two points on it, lineA and lineB. This performs two calls to Vector3::MagnitudeSquared(), which do not call CH_SQRT(). If the closest point to the line is outside the limits of lineA and lineB.

Parameters:
point - point to test against line
lineA - first point on line
lineB - second point on line
[out] distance_squared - shortest distance squared
Returns:
bool - if the point is within the limits

chain::Real chain::Utl::DistanceToLineSquared ( const Vector3 &  point,
const Vector3 &  lineA,
const Vector3 &  lineB 
) [static]

Calculate the shortest distance squared between a point and a line.

The line is defined by two points on it, lineA and lineB. This performs two calls to Vector3::MagnitudeSquared(), which do not call CH_SQRT().

Parameters:
point - point to test against line
lineA - first point on line
lineB - second point on line
Returns:
chain::Real - shortest distance squared
See also:
DistanceToLine()
Bug:
If point is not equal to (0,0,0) then incorrect answer is returned

bool chain::Utl::LineSphereIntersection ( const Vector3 &  lineA,
const Vector3 &  lineB,
const Vector3 &  sC,
const Real &  sR,
Vector3 *  iA,
Vector3 *  iB 
) [static]

Calculate the points of intersection between a line and a sphere.

The line is defined by two points on it, lineA and lineB, and the sphere is defined by its centre and radius, sC and sR. If there were line-sphere intersections they will be returned in iA and iB.

Parameters:
lineA - first point on line
lineB - second point on line
sC - Centre of sphere
sR - Radius of sphere
[out] iA - first point of intersection
[out] iB - second point of intersection
Returns:
bool - true if intersections occurred
Note:
points of intersection may be equal in the case of glancing intersections.

bool chain::Utl::PointWithin ( const Vector3 &  subject,
Vector3  upper,
Vector3  lower,
bool  sorted = true 
) [static]

Test if a point is within a 3D cube.

The point subject is tested against a axis aligned cube defined by the far upper right point upper, and the near lower left point lower

Parameters:
subject - The test point
upper - The squares far upper right corner
lower - The squares near lower left corner
sorted - If the upper and lower limits have been correctly sorted. (ie all values in upper > lower)
Returns:
bool - true if inside the square

bool chain::Utl::PointWithin ( const Vector2 &  subject,
Vector2  upper,
Vector2  lower,
bool  sorted = true 
) [static]

Test if a point is within a 2D square.

The point subject is tested against a axis aligned square defined by the upper right point upper, and the lower left point lower

Parameters:
subject - The test point
upper - The squares upper right corner
lower - The squares lower left corner
sorted - If the upper and lower limits have been correctly sorted. (ie all values in upper > lower)
Returns:
bool - true if inside the square
